program_description: This program provides loans and loan guarantees to energy developers for distributed energy projects, including grid-connected renewable energy projects, that provide wholesale or retail electricity to existing USDA Rural Development, Rural Utility Service (RUS) Electric Program borrowers or other electric utilities serving rural communities.
eligible_applicants_2: Energy project developers for distributed energy projects with a power purchase agreement (PPA) that serves rural customers.
eligible_applicants_3: Wholly-owned subsidiaries of an existing RUS borrower
loan_terms_max_rus_loan_amount: For others besides existing RUS borrowers, the maximum RUS loan amount is 75% of the total project costs.
loan_terms_max_loan_length: The length of the loan cannot exceed 30 years.
how_to_get_started_contact: Contact the Rural Utility Service, Office of Loan Origination and Approval Deputy Assistant Administrator.
eligible_area_criteria: Projects must serve areas with less than 20,000 residents. If less than 75% of the power goes to rural areas, then the loan amount is limited to the percentage provided to rural areas.
governing_program_1_name: The Code of Federal Regulations Title 7, Subtitle B, Chapter 17 Part 1710
governing_program_2_name: The Rural Electrification Act of 1936, as amended through P.L. 118-22, enacted November 17, 2023
funds_use_1: Energy generation projects, including renewable energy projects
application_deadline_info: For application deadline information check the Distributed Generation Energy Project Financing Program webpage
qr_code_description: Distributed Generation Energy Project Financing Website
note_general_advice: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local USDA Rural Development office for help.
note_equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
